Computers can intuit for people: Google chief London: In 50 years, computers will be able to intuit for people, Eric Schmidt , the chief of internet search engine giant Google, predicts. There will be a ubiquitous computational capability so amazing that people will assume that it is an assistant. It knows who you are, it knows what you do, it makes suggestions, it intuits things for you, Eric Schmidt told British daily the Telegraph. View result Eric Schmidt said that people who" opt in" to the system will begin experiencing a much richer relationship with technology, aided by their computerised" personal assistant

CEO( he will regain the title when Eric Schmidt steps aside in April), spoke at length on the value of white spaces during an event at the New America Foundation in May, 2008. But making use of white spaces will require some coordination, so that upcoming TV band wireless networking devices don't interfere with licensed TV band users like broadcast television stations. has joined the Defending Social Security Caucus newly organized by fellow Democratic Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont." Social Security has not contributed a dime to the debt or the deficit," he said, calling the program rock-solid for at least another 27 years. That was a reference to the moment when Social Security's trustees project that the system's trust fund-- financed by payroll taxes that are segregated from other federal levies-- will run out.
